article.headline: USC 81, Lafayette 59
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- LOS ANGELES (AP) -- After USC's embarrassing 15-point loss to Cal Poly on Monday night, Trojans guard Desmon Farmer took matters into his own hands Sunday night against Lafayette. Farmer scored 21 of his game-high 23 points in the first half to lead USC to an 81-59 rout of the Leopards in front of 3,218 at the Sports Arena. "I just wanted to come out and get guys fired up, said Farmer, who made eight of 17 shots from the floor. "I just tried to bring out the positive energy and get the team going." Farmer scored 13 points in the first 6:25 as USC (5-4) built a 19-0 lead. The senior guard made his first four shots, including three from three-point range. Lafayette (8-2), which had an eight-game winning streak coming into the game, missed its first 11 field-goal attempts and failed to score for nearly the first seven minutes. "They were going to go for a knockout punch right away, which they did," Leopards coach Fran O'Hanlon said. "We got some open looks and if we knock down a few of those threes, maybe we're in it early." Farmer dominated despite contracting the flu two days before Christmas. "It was kind of hard coming to practice," he said. "My lungs really weren't letting me produce. I had to leave practice early because my stomach starting acting up again." Farmer still felt the effects Sunday. "After a couple of trips down the court, I asked coach to take me out," he said referring to USC coach Henry Bibby. "He told me to wait a minute, so I had to push it some more. Then I finally got my second wind." Farmer's second wind helped USC repel a Lafayette rally. The Leopards used an 11-0 run to narrow their deficit to 23-15 with 7:36 left in the first half. But Farmer's six points paced a 14-0 run that extended the Trojans' lead to 37-15 with 4:50 left before halftime. Jeff McMillan had four points during the run and finished with 18. DeBerry led Lafayette with 14 points. Sean Knitter and Andrei Capusan added 11 points apiece.
